TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit FontWeight extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

summary.span: Refers to the density of a typeface, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.

span.span: Refers to the density of a typeface, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 太さの違いは、増加のストロークまたはその同じタイプフェイスの「通常」の文字と比較して、タイプフェイスの特定の文字に関連付けられている太さによって一般に区別されます。Weight differences are generally differentiated by an increased stroke or thickness that is associated with a given character in a typeface, as compared to a "normal" character from that same typeface. **注**しないすべての重みはすべてのタイプフェイス使用できます。**Note** Not all weights are available for all typefaces. 重みがタイプフェイスの利用できない場合は、最も近い一致する重みの値が返されます。When a weight is not available for a typeface, the closest matching weight is returned. ## XAML 属性の使用方法XAML Attribute Usage ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 明るいフォントの太さがフォントの太さを太くよりも低いです。Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights. たとえば、"Light"または"Normal"のフォントの太さより小さい値が、"UltraBold"のフォントの太さです。For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight. ## Examples 次のコード例で、メソッドが 2 つの評価に使用オブジェクト。In the following code example, the method is used to evaluate two objects. [!code-csharp[FontSnippets#FontSnippet11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FontSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#fontsnippet11)] [!code-vb[FontSnippets#FontSnippet11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FontSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#fontsnippet11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 詳細については、 [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass`値を参照してください、 [「フォント ファイル テーブル」](http://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/otff.htm) OpenType 仕様のセクション。For more information about the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass` value , see the ["Font File Tables"](http://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/otff.htm) section of the OpenType specification.
